means: 前后矛盾的，不合逻辑的

sentence.Network_cn: 这样大发脾气与他所树立的个人形象不相称。

sentence.Network_en: Moon, as great as he is, has had some inconsistent days.
sentence.Network_cn: 伟大如穆恩者，也有状态起伏的时候。

sentence.Network_en: This legislation is inconsistent with what they call Free Trade.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项立法与他们所谓的自由贸易相抵触。

entry.def: If you describe someone as inconsistent, you are criticizing them for not behaving in the same way every time a similar situation occurs.

example.tran: 你这人反复无常,真叫人难以捉摸。
领导犹豫不定、出尔反尔的行为

entry.tran: 不能始终如一的;时好时坏的
entry.def: Someone or something that is inconsistent does not stay the same, being sometimes good and sometimes bad.

example.ex: We had a terrific start to the season, but recently we've been inconsistent...
example.tran: 赛季之初我们有非常好的开局,但最近却时好时坏。

example.ex: Moon, as great as he is, has had some inconsistent days.
example.tran: 伟大如穆恩者,也有状态起伏的时候。

entry.def: If two statements are inconsistent, one cannot possibly be true if the other is true.

example.ex: The evidence given in court was inconsistent with what he had previously told them.
example.tran: 法庭上的证词与他当初告诉他们的不一致。

entry.def: If something is inconsistent with a set of ideas or values, it does not fit in well with them or match them.

example.ex: This legislation is inconsistent with what they call Free Trade...
example.tran: 这项立法与他们所谓的自由贸易相抵触。

example.ex: The outburst was inconsistent with the image he has cultivated.
example.tran: 这样大发脾气与他所树立的个人形象不相称。

means.word_mean: 2. not capable of being made consistent or harmonious;

auth_sentence.content: It was inconsistent with our intent and our policy.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was inconsistent with our intent and our policy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was inconsistent with our intent and our policy.

auth_sentence.content: Critics also say the NFL's position is inconsistent.
auth_sentence.res_content: Critics also say the NFL's position is inconsistent.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Industry experts say inconsistent government policies have discouraged investors.

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand, rejection occurs when others treat you in a manner that is inconsistent with yourself definition.
He thought he was a good public official, but the voters obviously thought otherwise— Their vote was inconsistent with his self-concept

means.word_mean: (思想、意见等)不一致的, 不协调的

sentences.cn: 她的论点本质上是相互矛盾的。

sentences.en: His dissolute life is inconsistent with his puritan upbringing.
sentences.cn: 他的放荡生活和他的清教徒教养相悖。

means.word_mean: 易变的, 不稳定的, 反复无常的

sentences.en: He is inconsistent in his views.

sentences.cn: 他们的足球踢得时好时坏。
